title.en: Research Process and Methods in Folkloristics

description.en:
During the practice, the student:
Collaborates with the non-university partner to develop a practice plan and formulate practice objectives.
Implements the tasks outlined in the plan.
Submits a written practice report, which critically analyzes and evaluates the acquired experience and the perspectives on folklore processes revealed within the project (including the methods used, their application, results obtained, etc.).
Presents the research findings to the non-university partner (where fieldwork was conducted) in a suitable format and manner.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to provide an opportunity for the application of folklore-related knowledge in various non-university settings (such as another research institution, organization, company, NGO, etc.) and to analyze this experience.
objectives.et: Õppeaine eesmärgiks on pakkuda võimalust folkloristika-alaste teadmiste rakendamiseks erinevate ülikooliväliste partnerite juures (nt teine uurimisasutus, organisatsioon, ettevõte, MTÜ vm) ning seda analüüsida.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon successful completion of the course, the student will be able to:
Apply specialized knowledge to carry out a practical project at a non-university partner.
learning_outcomes.et: 1. rakendada erialaseid teadmisi praktilise projekti läbiviimiseks ülikoolivälise partneri juures.

learning_outcomes.en: Critically analyze the knowledge and experiences acquired during the practice and assess the possibilities of applying folklore-related knowledge, including the use of various sources, the significance of context, limitations of use and impact, and creative interpretations.
learning_outcomes.et: 2. oskab kriitiliselt analüüsida praktika käigus omandatud teadmisi ja kogemusi ja suudab analüüsida folkloristika-alaste teadmiste rakendamisvõimalusi, s.h. erinevate allikate kasutamist, konteksti olulisust, kasutus- ja mõjupiiranguid ning loovaid interpretatsioone.

notes.et:
Õppeaine toimub igal aastal, sügis- ja kevadsemestril, ent registreerimiseks seda ei avata. Üliõpilane otsib iseseisvalt praktika sooritamiseks sobiva partneri, konsulteerides rahvaluule osakonna praktikakoordinaatori Kristel Kivariga (kristel.kivari@ut.ee), kellega lepitakse kokku praktika mahtudes, ajakavas ning plaanis. 
The course takes place every year, in both the autumn and spring semesters, but it is not open for registration. The student independently seeks a suitable partner for completing the practice and consulting with Kristel Kivari, the coordinator of practical training at the Department of Folklore (kristel.kivari@ut.ee), to agree on the scope, schedule, and plan of the practice.

grade_preconditions.et:
Praktikaaruande esitamine.
Submission of the Practice Report.

grade_evaluation.et:
Praktikaaruanne arutatakse läbi praktika ülikoolipoolse koordinaatoriga, vajadusel tehakse täpsustusi ja parandusi.
The practice report is discussed with the university's coordinator of practical training. If necessary, clarifications and corrections are made.
